notes: Issue #3372 is a feature request (type/feature-request), not a bug report. The reporter asks to replace the Microsoft.WindowsAppSDK metapackage dependency (v1.4.230913002) with the narrower Microsoft.WindowsAppSDK.WinUI sub-package (v1.8) in SkiaSharp.Views.WinUI. The factual claim was verified: both the source csproj and the published NuGet package (3.116.1) reference the full metapackage. Since there is no crash, exception, or wrong output to observe, no reproduction is possible — this is a dependency restructuring request.

reproductionSteps.description: Inspect SkiaSharp.Views.WinUI.csproj in source to verify current dependency on Microsoft.WindowsAppSDK metapackage
Download published SkiaSharp.Views.WinUI 3.116.1 nupkg and inspect nuspec to verify the dependency is also present in the released package
reproductionSteps.output: nuspec confirms dependency: <dependency id="Microsoft.WindowsAppSDK" version="1.4.230913002" /> in both net6.0-windows10.0.19041 and net8.0-windows10.0.19041 target framework groups.

reproductionSteps.description: Assess reproducibility — this is a feature request (type/feature-request) with no bug behavior to reproduce. The claim that the metapackage is referenced is factually confirmed, but there is no error, crash, or wrong output to observe.

versionResults.notes: Feature request — no bug behavior to test. Verified nupkg depends on Microsoft.WindowsAppSDK 1.4.230913002 metapackage as reported.
Source csproj still references Microsoft.WindowsAppSDK 1.4.230913002 metapackage — feature not yet implemented.

blockers: This is a feature request (type/feature-request), not a bug. There is no crash, exception, compiler error, or wrong output to reproduce — the reporter is requesting a dependency change from Microsoft.WindowsAppSDK (metapackage) to Microsoft.WindowsAppSDK.WinUI (sub-package).
Full verification of the dependency impact would require a Windows environment with WinUI tooling, which is not available on macOS.
